citeinfo.title: 1930 Mississippi River Pool 5 - Historic Aerial Photo Mosaic

descript.abstract: MrSID lossless mosaic of the 1929 aerial photos for Pool 5, on the Mississippi River.
descript.purpose: The mosaic will serve as a historical document showing the Pool 5 area pre lock and dam.
descript.supplinf: This image is stored in a LizardTech MrSID Lossless Generation 3 format.

idinfo.accconst: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty has been expressed or implied regarding the individual use of the data or aggregate use with other data, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a U.S. Geological Survey server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The U.S. Geological Survey shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein
idinfo.useconst: The data represents the results of data collection/processing for a specific activity and indicates the general existing conditions. As such , it is only valid for its intended use, content, and accuracy specifications. The user is responsible for the results of any application of the data other than its intended purpose.
idinfo.datacred: US Army Corps of Engineers Upper Mississippi River Restoration- Environmental Management Program -- Long Term Resource Monitoring Program element and USGS's Upper Midwest Environmental Sciences Center
idinfo.native: Environment as of Metadata Creation: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 10.2 (Build 3552) Service Pack [N/A] (Build [N/A])

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: The original imagery was photographically mosaiced into very large prints, many years ago. These prints were scanned and georeferenced with available control points visible in existing orthophotography. Positional accuracy varies across the final image due to many factors. Please use imagery for historical reference purposes only.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

citeinfo.origin: St. Paul District - US Army Corps of Engineers
citeinfo.title: 1930 Photo Mosaic - Pool 5

srcinfo.srccontr: Source information used in support of the development of the data set.

procstep.procdesc: 1) The images were scanned at 400 DPI 2) The images were color adjusted using Adobe Photoshop 4.0 3) The images were georeferenced using ESRI ArcMap 8.3 4) The images were clipped in ERDAS Imagine 8.7 5) The images were Mosaiced using ArcView 3.2 Image Analysis 6) Lossless compression using MrSID 4.0 software

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. distinfo.custom: The data set is not available online. Interested parties should contactmetadata_coordiantor@umesc.er.usgs.gov
